intro: Fulcaldea laurifolia, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a glossy appearance. Fulcaldea laurifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil.
